bio:
I’m a high school senior in Boston, MA. I make things with JavaScript, Node.js, React, React Native, and most recently Laravel.

I’m on [twitter](https://twitter.com/benborgers) and [github](https://github.com/benborgers). If you wanna get in touch, I love getting emails: [benborgers@hey.com](mailto:benborgers@hey.com)

Here’s a **skimmable bullet point timeline** about me:

bullets.text: Built version 2 of [Blocks](https://blocks.elk.sh), an app for my school’s schedule used by 1,800+ students and teachers
Building [Bagel Institute](https://bagel.institute), tools for more interactive college teaching
Return software development summer internship at IBM
Freelance: built the website and class registration system for [Diyi](https://diyiboston.com), an online school based out of Boston
Freelance: worked on [Rep.ly](https://rep.ly), a public Q&A platform by the agency [Dip](https://dip.org)
Building [Underline](https://underline.email), a dead-simple and affordable way to send newsletter
Built [Coronavirus by County](https://elk.sh/coronavirus-by-county), a mini site that shows the number of COVID cases in your county using data from The New York Times
Freelance: built an [app for Sophrosyne](https://sophrosyne.now.sh), a mental health-related club at my high school
Built [Potion](https://github.com/benborgers/potion), an open-source reverse-engineered API for Notion
Built [Pausebot](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/pausebot/id1504920727), an iOS app that helps you pause videos on TikTok for the pause trend
Software development summer internship at IBM
Built [EMOJICDN](https://emojicdn.elk.sh), a simple API for getting an image of any emoji that serves over two million requests per month
Wrote a collection of [unit summaries](https://chem.elk.sh) for AP Chemistry
Wrote a [study guide of questions](https://bio.elk.sh) for preparing for the AP Biology test
